chatwebservice

Class ChatWebService

  • java.lang.Object
    • chatwebservice.ChatWebService

  • public class ChatWebService
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Web Service providing the methods for the ChatSystem. The ChatSystem should be created using the MVC (Model-View-Controller) paradigm and as the Model and Controllers have been provided to you, your job is to create the Views that allow the user to interact with the system. You will need to build a system that has a minimum of three screens: namely a login screen (to allow the user to login), a registration screen (to allow a new user to add their details to the system, and a main screen that allows for posting messages and displaying incoming/outgoing messages. Note: no more than one screen should be visible to the user at any time.

    • Method Detail

      • registerUser

        public int registerUser(java.lang.String name,
                        java.lang.String username,
                        java.lang.String password,
                        java.lang.String rptpassword)
        This web service operation is used to add a new user to the system. It uses the register method of the ChatDBOperations class to work.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the new user.
        username - the username of the new user.
        password - the password for the new user.
        rptpassword - the password entered again.
        Returns:
        the user ID of the user. If registration is unsuccessful, would return 0 or negative value.

      • checkLogin

        public int checkLogin(java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String password)
        This web service operation is used to check credentials of a user attempting to login. It uses the checkLogin method of the ChatDBOperations class to work.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the person attempting to login.
        password - the password of the person attempting to login.
        Returns:
        the user ID of the user. If login is unsuccessful, would return 0 or negative value.

      • newSession

        public int newSession(int uid)
        This web service operation is used to create a new session after a user logged in. It uses the newSession method of the ChatDBOperations class to work.
        Parameters:
        uid - the user ID.
        Returns:
        the session ID. If the operation is unsuccessful, would return 0 or negative value.

      • logOut

        public boolean logOut(int uid,
                      int sid)
        This web method implements a log out operation by deactivating the user session. It uses the logOut method of the ChatDBOperations class to work.
        Parameters:
        uid - the user ID.
        sid - the session ID.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • postMessage

        public boolean postMessage(int uid,
                           int sid,
                           java.lang.String receiver,
                           java.lang.String message)
        This web method sends a message to another user. It uses the postMessage method of the ChatDBOperations class to work.
        Parameters:
        uid - the user ID.
        sid - the session ID.
        receiver - the username of the receiver.
        message - the message to be sent.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • getMessages

        public Message[] getMessages(int uid,
                             int sid,
                             java.lang.String receiver,
                             int mid)
        This web service operation retrieves messages between two users. It uses the getMessage method of the ChatDBOperations class to work. This method is expected to be called periodically (every few seconds) using a thread.
        Parameters:
        uid - the user ID of the current user.
        sid - the session ID.
        receiver - the username of the other user.
        mid - the message ID threshold. All messages with message IDs larger than that number will be retrieved. This will allow to store the largest mid found in the Message array and use it in the next call of this web service operation.
        Returns:
        the messages returned in a Message array chronologically (see class Message).

      • getUsers

        public java.lang.String[] getUsers(boolean asc)
        This web service operation retrieves all registered users. It uses the getUsers method of the ChatDBOperations class to work.
        Parameters:
        asc - if set to true, returns the users in alphabetical order.
        Returns:
        the users in a String array.

      • postMulticast

        public boolean postMulticast(int uid,
                             int sid,
                             java.lang.String message)
        This web service operation sends a message to all users. It uses the postMulticast method of the ChatDBOperations class to work.
        Parameters:
        uid - the user ID.
        sid - the session ID.
        message - the message to be sent.
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • getMulticast

        public Message[] getMulticast(int sid,
                              int mid)
        This web service operation retrieves all Multicast messages. It uses the getMulticast method of the ChatDBOperations class to work. This method is expected to be called periodically (every few seconds) using a thread.
        Parameters:
        sid - the session ID.
        mid - the message ID threshold. All messages with message IDs larger than that number will be retrieved. This will allow to store the largest mid found in the Message array and use it in the next call of this web service operation.
        Returns:
        the messages returned in a Message array chronologically (see class Message).
